tool_description: Connect with 40 + eCommerce solutions in just one API, and start making requests in under 15 min. Integrations inlcude Wix, Shopify, Amazon, Mercado Libre, Unicommerce, SAP Commerce and more. https://docs.ecartapi.com
title: EcartAPI

api_list.name: Getasinglecustomer
api_list.description:
Searches for the selected customer and shows detailed information.

Important information:
  • The costumer's ID must exist

api_list.name: Variants14
api_list.description:

api_list.name: Getallproductvariants
api_list.description:
Searches for all the registered variants of a single product.

Important information:
  • The product's ID must exist

FILTERS

Filter Description
limit Limit size of the search.
page Pagination number.
sinceId Filter items since the Id given.
offset Lower limit of the results block. Modifies the range of the results provided, range goes from offset to limit.

api_list.name: Category
api_list.description: Creates a new category.

api_list.name: Getsallorder'sfulfillments
api_list.description:
Shows all of the order's fulfillments detailed.

Important information:
  • Filters are subject to ecommerce.
  • The order's ID must exist

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Lower limit of the results block. Modifies the range of the results provided, range goes from offset to limit

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Pagination number or token (Only when page object is available in response)

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit size of the search

optional_parameters.name: sinceId
optional_parameters.description: Filter items since the Id given

optional_parameters.name: allStores
optional_parameters.description: Search items in all stores. ONLY Shiphero.

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by date created from.

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by date created to.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by date updated to.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by date updated from.

api_list.name: Getallcategories
api_list.description:
Searches for all the available categories.

FILTERS

Filter Description
ids Filter categories by the ids given
limit Limit size of the search
page Pagination number.
sinceId Filter categories since the Id given
name Filter categories by name
productId Filter categories by product id
siteId Filter items by site id
offset Lower limit of the results block. Modifies the range of the results provided, range goes from offset to limit

optional_parameters.name: siteId
optional_parameters.description: Filter results based of the site id.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Default 50. Quantity of documents to be returned in the response.

optional_parameters.name: productId
optional_parameters.description: Filter results based of products.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: Filter results based of the category name.

optional_parameters.name: sinceId
optional_parameters.description: Filter results to be returned only after certain ID.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Allows iteration through the results.

api_list.name: Countallproducts
Fulfillments
api_list.description:
This request creates a fulfillment on an Order

Features.

The items array is optional it can be send on selected ecommerces to create partial fulfillments, if you want to make a complete fulfillment just skip sending this information and the fulfillment information will be applied to all the items in the order. This API request has a feature that some ecommerces support, which allows to send the items of the order you choose to be fulfilled allowing for partial fulfillments. *(THIS IS ONLY ON SELECTED ECOMMERCES REVIEW THE SUPPORTED REQUESTS BY CART FOLDER TO SEE IF THE ECOMMERCE YOU ARE USING ALLOWS THIS FEATURE)*

NOTE:

We recommend that if you are going to be making this request to all of the ecommerces we offer to follow this payload as it has all the required information of the overall ecommerce's.

If you are only going to be working with a selected few ecommerce we recommend to go to our Supported Requests By Cart folder and using the payload from the ecommerce you choose to work with.

**Important information:**

  • The order's ID must exist

api_list.name: Createsinglecarrierservice
api_list.description:
Request that creates a shipping carrier service.

Carrier service create properties.

| **Attributes** | **Meaning** |
| --- | --- |
| name(String) | Name that will represent your service on the seller store. |
| url(String) | URL where you will receive the live quotation requests. |
| settings(Object) | Settings that modify the response the ecommerce will receive. See table A for more information. |

TABLE A

Attributes inside the settings object

| **Attributes** | **Meaning** |
| --- | --- |
| hideDeliveryDate (String/Boolean) | Default is `false`. Choose if the delivery expected dates will appear on the check out page. |

api_list.name: Getallcustomers
api_list.description:
FILTERS

Filter Description
ids Filter cutomers by Id's provided
limit Limit size of the search
page Pagination number.
sinceId Filter customers since the Id given
createdAt[from] Filter customers by date created from. When used createdAt[to]Required
createdAt[to] Filter customers by date created to. When used createdAt[from]Required
updatedAt[from] Filter customers by date updated from. When used updatedAt[to]Required
updatedAt[to] Filter customers by date updated to. When used updatedAt[from]Required
name Filter categories by name
search Search by string
email Search customers by email
offset Lower limit of the results block. Modifies the range of the results provided range goes from offset to limit

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: Search based of email information.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter results between a date range. updatedAt[from]Required

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: Filter results based of the customers name.

optional_parameters.name: ids
optional_parameters.description: Returns the items inside of a list of ids separated by comas

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Allows iteration through the results.

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter results between their creation date range. createdAt[from]Required

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Default 50. Quantity of documents to be returned in the response.

optional_parameters.name: sinceId
optional_parameters.description: Filter results to be returned only after certain ID.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter results by date last update.

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter results by date of creation.

optional_parameters.name: search
optional_parameters.description: General search on the resource.

api_list.name: Getallproducts
api_list.description:
Request used to obtain all the products in a store catalog.

Find a general representation of all the filters and information EcartAPI can abet.

#### For more detailed information please refer to our Supported Requests By Cart folder and find the eCommerce of your choice.

optional_parameters.name: searchType
optional_parameters.description: General search on the resource.

optional_parameters.name: status[active]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by their inventory availability status.

optional_parameters.name: sinceId
optional_parameters.description: Filter results to be returned only after certain ID.

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items between their creation date range. createdAt[from]Required

optional_parameters.name: price[min]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items based on the minimum price.

optional_parameters.name: price[max]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items based on the max price.

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by date of creation.

optional_parameters.name: productType
optional_parameters.description: Filter results based of the product's type.

optional_parameters.name: sku
optional_parameters.description: Filter results by sku.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Default desc. Order of the results returned.

optional_parameters.name: ids
optional_parameters.description: Send a list of id's separated by commas.

optional_parameters.name: status[status]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by the current status of the product.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: Filter results based of the item's name.

optional_parameters.name: categoryId
optional_parameters.description: Filter results based of the category they are in.

optional_parameters.name: status[visibility]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by their visibility status.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items between a date range. updatedAt[from]Required

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Allows iteration through the results

optional_parameters.name: sortBy
optional_parameters.description: Default createdAt. The response will be sorted based on the key chosen.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Default 50. Quantity of documents to be returned in the response.
optional_parameters.default: String. Min: 0 Max: Subject to ecommerce.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter items by date last update.

| **Attributes** | **Meaning** |
| --- | --- |
| name(String) | Name that will represent your service on the seller store. |
| url(String) | URL where you will receive the live quotation requests. |
| settings(Object) | Settings that modify the response the ecommerce will receive. See table A for more information. |

TABLE A

Attributes inside the settings object

| **Attributes** | **Meaning** |
| --- | --- |
| hideDeliveryDate (String/Boolean) | Default is `false`. Choose if the delivery expected dates will appear on the check out page. |

Getallorders
api_list.description:
Note:
Filters are available depending of the ecommerce

optional_parameters.name: search
optional_parameters.description: Search by key-word

optional_parameters.name: sinceId
optional_parameters.description: Request orders since a certain Id

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Pagination is numbered or by token(only when response includes page object)

optional_parameters.name: status[financial]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by financial status. Values subject to ecommerce

optional_parameters.name: status[status]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by status. Values subject to ecommerce

optional_parameters.name: draft
optional_parameters.description: Shopify Only.

optional_parameters.name: status[ecartapi]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by status.
optional_parameters.default: [ pending, authorized, paid, partially_paid, refunded, partially_refunded, cancelled, delete, shipped, other ]

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by date created to.

optional_parameters.name: ids
optional_parameters.description: List of order ids separated by comas

optional_parameters.name: recent
optional_parameters.description: Shows the most recent orders, including the ones with dates before e expiration_date and have not been qualified

optional_parameters.name: fulfillmentStatus
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by the fulfillment status. Values subject to ecommerce

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Lower limit of the results block. Modifies the range of the results provided, range goes from offset to limit

optional_parameters.name: createdAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by date created from.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[to]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by date updated to.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit of documents requested by call

optional_parameters.name: status[id]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by status Id. Values are subject to ecommerce

optional_parameters.name: allStores
optional_parameters.description: Search items in all stores.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Shows orders by ascending or descending dates.

optional_parameters.name: updatedAt[from]
optional_parameters.description: Filter orders by date updatedfrom.

Category
api_list.description: Creates a new category.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v2/categories"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v2/categories"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Fulfillments
api_list.description:
This request creates a fulfillment on an Order

Features.

The items array is optional it can be send on selected ecommerces to create partial fulfillments, if you want to make a complete fulfillment just skip sending this information and the fulfillment information will be applied to all the items in the order. This API request has a feature that some ecommerces support, which allows to send the items of the order you choose to be fulfilled allowing for partial fulfillments. *(THIS IS ONLY ON SELECTED ECOMMERCES REVIEW THE SUPPORTED REQUESTS BY CART FOLDER TO SEE IF THE ECOMMERCE YOU ARE USING ALLOWS THIS FEATURE)*

NOTE:

We recommend that if you are going to be making this request to all of the ecommerces we offer to follow this payload as it has all the required information of the overall ecommerce's.

If you are only going to be working with a selected few ecommerce we recommend to go to our Supported Requests By Cart folder and using the payload from the ecommerce you choose to work with.

**Important information:**

  • The order's ID must exist
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v2/orders/orderId/fulfillments"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v2/orders/{orderid}/fulfillments"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Cancelfulfilment
api_list.description:
Cancels an order's fulfillment.

Important information:
  • The order's ID must exist
  • The order's fulfillment ID must exist
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v2/orders/orderId/fulfillments/id/cancel"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Orders
api_list.description:
Creates new orders.

Important information:
  • Country codes must be 2 digits
  • State codes must be 2 digits
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v2/orders"

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ecartapi1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }
